description: Awarded an Orange Belt from pwn.college, which consisted of completing CTF challenges involving communicating with web servers via HTTP; utilizing x86-64 assembly to write an HTTP server; using tools like gdb, IDA, Ghidra, and Angr Management to reverse engineer binaries; intercepting and manipulating network communication, from connecting to remote hosts to performing man-in-the-middle attacks; solving various cryptography challenges ranging from decoding base64 data to performing simplified TLS handshakes; exploiting various access control issues for the UNIX Discretionary Access Control model; exploiting various web security vulnerabilities such as path traversal, command injection, authentication bypass, SQL injection, XSS, and CSRF; and exploiting binary programs via SUID binary abuse, shellcode injection, and stack buffer overflows.

issuer: Arizona State University - Fulton College of Engineering
description: Recognized on the Dean's List for achieving a term GPA of 3.5 or higher while taking 12 or more credits.
